summary: Plan an app to support individual soldiersâ€™ mental readiness, resilience, decision-making, communication, team cohesion/identity, and embodiment of Army values, including guided reflection on positive life outcomes from military service, optional squad-level peer groups for idea sharing, and content informed by Army doctrine/field manuals (e.g., FM 7-22) plus relevant external high-performance/team resources, with a clear non-DOD/US Army disclaimer.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and a user profile model that supports a required, unique chosen username and basic onboarding (accept disclaimer + guidelines acknowledgement).

Add an explicit, persistent non-affiliation disclaimer stating the app is not created by, endorsed by, or affiliated with the U.S. Army or the DoD, and ensure it is accessible pre-login and post-login.
Make the app invite-only with a hard cap of 45 registered users: users must provide a valid invite code to register, and the backend must prevent creating the 46th user even if the UI is bypassed.

Implement private journaling/reflection entries that are private by default, with optional explicit sharing to an invite-only squad group; support create/read/update/delete for the author and read-only visibility for shared entries within the group.

Implement squad-level groups that are invite-only and support up to 45 members per group, including: create group, generate/rotate invite code, join by code, leave group, and view members list with usernames.

Add doctrine-informed and high-performance-team-informed content modules that support both (a) quoting/summarizing with citations and (b) interpreted exercises/reflections; include sections aligned to mental readiness, resilience, decision-making, communication, team cohesiveness, and identity/Army values in daily life.

Add community guidelines and reporting features for group-shared content: users can view guidelines at any time; users can report a shared entry or a user in their group with a reason and optional details; provide an admin/moderator review UI to view reports and resolve/close them.

Define and apply a coherent, non-military-agency-branded visual theme across the app (typography, spacing, color palette, components) suitable for reflective journaling and small-group sharing; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Define requirements and scope for an app to enhance military performance
Provide guided reflection/journaling to help soldiers identify positive outcomes in their lives created by being a soldier
Include modules/features targeting mental readiness, resilience, decision-making, communication, team cohesiveness, and identity/Army values in daily life
Optional ability for soldiers to connect with other soldiers to share ideas
Add an explicit disclaimer that the app is not created by the US Army and does not represent the DoD
Support squad-level small team groups for peer connection/idea sharing
User identity and privacy controls: chosen usernames; journals private by default unless explicitly shared
Incorporate Army doctrine/field manuals (e.g., FM 7-22) and other high-performance/team resources into app content
Add community moderation safeguards for squad-level groups (community guidelines + reporting)

architectural_notes: Peer connection model: small team groups at squad level (not broad public network).
Identity model: users use chosen usernames for shared/group interactions.
Privacy model: journaling/reflections are private by default; sharing is explicit/opt-in per entry.
Squad-level groups: invite-only access; target group size up to ~45 connected users.
Doctrine content approach: include both direct quote/summarize with citations and interpreted/translated exercises and lessons.
Group safety: include community guidelines and user reporting features for shared content.
projectName: Invite-only soldier resilience app with private journaling, squad groups (max 45 users), doctrine-informed content, and reporting
